newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar still in range, ends barely up.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar still in range, ends barely up.

text.p: Dull and rangebound activity persisted in the CSCE world sugar market as thin volume and a dearth of news remained the day's main features.
March closed up 0.02 to 10.65, having ranged from 10.68 to 10.59. The back months ended the day 0.05 to 0.01 higher.
Volume was estimated at only 6,487 lots.
Support remained at 10.50 in March and resistance at 10.80.
"Producers are willing to sell on a scale-up basis from unchanged and the funds probably won't sell until (March) gets below 10.50, so there is no direct pressure," a broker said.
He said March would run buy stops around 10.80.
Dealers blamed thin activity in New York on tonight's annual London sugar dinner.
